Key Arguments: The proposed legislation could erode free speech in Australia.
The legislation violates Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, which protects freedom of opinion and expression.
Individuals should have the right to conduct their own research and form their own opinions without government interference.
The bill could lead to government overreach and abuse of power, resembling authoritarianism.

It is not the role of the government to tell people what they can and cannot say or think, and this entire bill smacks of authoritarianism.
